title: Bug 12906 - Cannot open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (error message should be displayed)
description: Bug 12906 - If a file is already opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor. The expected behavior is that an error message should be displayed in this case. The current behavior is that nothing happens when trying to open the file in another editor.
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor, no action is taken when trying to open the same file in another editor. There is no warning message or error message displayed.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, an error message should be displayed, informing the user that they cannot open the file in another editor until it is closed. The error message should prompt the user to close the file first before attempting to open it in a different editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for the Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on a Java file.
3. Select 'Open With' and choose 'System Editor'.
4. Note that nothing happens, and no error or warning message is displayed. The file should not be opened in the new editor.
